definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: From this corridor the visitor looks through carved marble screens to a central room.
sentences.chinese: 從廊道遊者可以穿過雕花大理石屏風直接看到裏屋。
的確很適合雕花果籃呢。

sentences.english: They are exquisitely carved, with a canopy on top.
sentences.chinese: 這種牀有着精緻的雕花，牀頂還有一頂花帳。

sentences.english: Both the pilasters and eaves are engraved with flowers, these really are fabulous.
sentences.chinese: 壁柱和瓦檐均雕花刻畫，富麗堂皇。

sentences.english: In the ancient incense hall also saw Mao, a carved beam.
sentences.chinese: 在最古老的毛氏香火堂，也只看到一條梁有雕花。

sentences.english: The style is four columns, three gates, three brims , five water dypasses in this wooden-like stone archway.
sentences.chinese: 該坊形制爲四柱三門三重檐五滴水仿木青石雕花牌坊。

sentences.english: Jeff kicked in the engraved wooden door.
sentences.chinese: 傑夫猛地一腳踢向那扇雕花木門。

sentences.english: This carved chest is a genuine antique.
sentences.chinese: 這隻雕花盒子是件古玩真品。

definition: lit. fine sculpting (idiom); fig. to work with extreme care and precision
interesting and appealing (of old locations, objects etc)
variant of 鎦金|镏金[liu2 jin1]
